sen.j: 養老律令（ようろうりつりょう）は、古代日本で757年（天平宝字元年）に施行された基本法令。
sen.e: Yoro Ritsuryo Code is the fundamental law enacted in 757 during the ancient period of Japan.
Yoro Ritsuryo Code is the fundamental law enacted in 757 during the ancient period of Japan.

sen.j: 構成は、律10巻12編、令10巻30編。
sen.e: The code consists of Ritsu book in 10 volumes, 12 sections, and Ryo book in 10 volumes, 30 sections.
The code consists of the Ritsu book in 10 volumes with 12 sections, and the Ryo book in 10 volumes with 30 sections.
sen.cmt: 冠詞、前置詞を補足しました。
sen.e: The code consists of the Ritsu book in 10 volumes with 12 sections, and the Ryo book in 10 volumes with 30 sections.

sen.j: 大宝律令に続く律令として施行され、古代日本の政治体制を規定する根本法令として機能したが、平安時代に入ると現実の社会・経済状況と齟齬をきたし始め、平安時代には格式の制定などによってこれを補ってきたが、遅くとも平安中期までにほとんど形骸化した。
sen.e: This code had been enacted as the succeeding fundamental law code to Taiho Ritsuryo Code, and it functioned as the essential laws and ordinances that prescribed the political system of ancient Japan; however, the code began to reveal the contradictions against the actual social and economic conditions once entered in Heian period, even though Kyakushiki code (amendments and enforcement regulations of ritsuryo code) was also enacted to support Ritsuryo Code--the Ritsuryo Code became mere name by as late as mid Heian period.

sen.e: There was no official announcement of abolishing the Ritsuryo code, thus it perfunctory remained until the Meiji Restoration period.

sen.j: 701年（大宝 (日本)元年）、藤原不比等らによる編纂によって大宝律令が成立したが、その後も不比等らは、日本の国情により適合した内容とするために、律令の撰修（改修）作業を継続していた。
sen.e: In 701, FUJIWARA no Fuhito and others compiled and established Taiho Ritsuryo Code, but he continued the compilation of the contents of Ritsuryo codes to meet the actual conditions of the country.

In 701, FUJIWARA no Fuhito and others compiled and established Taiho Ritsuryo Code, and they continued the compilation of the contents of the code to have it meet the actual conditions of the country.

sen.j: ところが、720年（養老4年）の不比等の死により律令撰修はいったん停止することとなった（ただし、その後も改訂の企てがあり、最終的に施行の際にその成果の一部が反映されたとの見方もある）。
sen.e: In 720, the compilation of the Ritsuryo codes was once suspended by the death of Fuhito. (However, there were still some projects to revise the Ritsuryo codes, and some study suggests that the final established codes reflected the results of those revision projects)

sen.e: But, in 720, the compilation of the code was once suspended by the death of Fuhito. (However, there were still some attempts to revise it after that, and some study suggests that the finally established code reflected the results of those revisionary projects.)

sen.j: その後、孝謙天皇の治世の757年5月、藤原仲麻呂の主導によって720年に撰修が中断していた新律令が施行されることとなった。
sen.e: In May 757, during the reign of Koken Empress, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro took initiative for the establishment of new Ritsuryo code, long after the suspension of the compilation activities of Ritsuryo code in 720.

Then, in May 757 during the reign of Empress Koken, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro took the initiative to establish the new Ritsuryo code, and finally it came into force long after the suspension of the compilation activities of Taiho Ritsuryo Code since in 720.
sen.cmt: 文法、及び表現ミス（Empress Koken）を直し、多少表現を変えました。
sen.e: Then, in May 757 during the reign of Empress Koken, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro took the initiative to establish the new Ritsuryo code, and finally it came into force long after the suspension of the compilation activities of Taiho Ritsuryo Code since in 720.

sen.j: これが養老律令である。
sen.e: This new Ritsuryo code is Yoro Ritsuryo Code.

sen.j: 旧大宝律令と新養老律令では、一部（戸令など）に重要な改正もあったものの、全般的に大きな差異はなく、語句や表現、法令不備の修正が主な相違点であった。
sen.e: Although there were some important revision made (ex. Koryo, family registration) from the former Taiho Ritsuryo to the new Yoro Ritsuryo, there was no significant difference between them, other than the vocabulary, expressions of the words, and some amendment of inadequate codes.

sen.j: 以後、桓武天皇の時代に養老律令の修正・追加を目的とした刪定律令（24条）・刪定令格（45条）の制定が行われたが短期間で廃止となり、以後日本において律令が編纂されることはなかった。
sen.e: Since then, the revisions and additions to Yoro Ritsuryo Code were made during the reign of Kanmu Emperor as Santei Ritsuryo (24 articles) and Santei Ryokyaku, (45 articles) but those were abolished in short period of time, and Ritsuryo Code was never complied again in the history of Japan since then.

sen.j: 養老律令それ自体は、散逸しており現存しない。

sen.j: しかし、令については、律令の注釈書として平安前期に編纂された『令義解』『令集解』に倉庫令・医疾令を除く全ての令が収録されており、復元可能となっている。
sen.e: However, all the codes of Yoro Ritsuryo are included in "Ryo no gige" (commentary on the Ryo) and "Ryo no shuge," (commentaries on the Civil Statutes) which were produced as the annotation book of the Ritsuryo codes in early Heian period; thus it was possible to restore the contents of the codes except the parts regarding regulation of warehouses and the regulation of medical service.

However, with regard to the Ryo (the administrative and civil code) part, all rules and regulations except those regarding warehouse management and medical service are included in "Ryo-no-gige" (commentaries on the Ryo) and "Ryo-no-shuge," (commentaries on the Civil Statutes) which were produced as annotation books of the Ritsuryo codes in the early Heian period; thus it is possible to restore the contents of the Rho book.
sen.cmt: 文法を直し、多少表現を変えました。令の意味を補足説明しました。
sen.e: However, with regard to the Ryo (the administrative and civil code) part, all rules and regulations except those regarding warehouse management and medical service are included in "Ryo-no-gige" (commentaries on the Ryo) and "Ryo-no-shuge," (commentaries on the Civil Statutes) which were produced as annotation books of the Ritsuryo codes in the early Heian period; thus it is possible to restore the contents of the Rho book.

sen.j: また、倉庫令・医疾令も他文献の逸文からほぼ復元されている。
sen.e: Those missing regulations of warehouses and medical service have also been restored from other fragments of the documents related with the Ritsuryo code.

sen.j: 養老律令は、大宝律令と大きな相違点はないため、養老律令施行後もそれ以前と変わらない政治運営が行われたと見られ、律令制史上の大きな意義は特にないとされている。
sen.e: The actual operation and the management of Yoro Ritsuryo Code after its establishment was conducted similarly with the operation of Taiho Ritsuryo Code, because Both Codes do not differed largely from each other, thus it is considered that Yoro Ritsuryo Code did not give significant impact in the history of Ritsuryo codes.

sen.e: Looking back the political situation around 757, Shomu Emperor who reigned over the central government died in 756, and multiple power groups inside of the government started the fight for taking initiative of the political influence.

sen.j: これらの状況から、養老律令施行の背景には、両者共通の祖父である不比等の成果を活用することで、不比等の政治を継承することを宣言するとともに、孝謙・仲麻呂政権の安定を図ろうとする政治的意図があったと考えられている。
sen.e: Judging from these evidences, the context of the establishment of Yoro Ritsuryo Code is revealed as the political intentions to make an announcement of the succession of the policy of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, who was the common grandfather of both Nakamaro and Koken Empress, while the administration of the government run by Koken Empress and Nakamaro sought for stabilizing the situation by establishing new code.

Judging from these contexts, it is believed that the establishment of Yoro Ritsuryo Code was produced by the political intentions of Empress Koken and Nakamaro to utilize the code which was the achievement of their common grandfather, FUJIWARA no Fuhito, aiming not only to announce their succession of the policy of Fuhito but also to seek for the stabilization of their political power.
